column5: I hear its back? what does anyone know about this? Any good websites to be had with any info? Im happy to hear this news!! bye bye ma bell and her $80 bucks a month

Someone I know,(not me of course) has been pulling his hair out, it's on, it's off, reboot, try again, etc, over and over, maybe now it's good to go, I wouldn't mind getting a basic unit for the trailer during the summer for the rainy evenings.

well, I have been reading about them. The thing is they need to be hooked up to the internet at all times. The problem with that is your IP address is recorded on a server and there have already been lawsuits. I think Im going to pass for now. In the meantime I have found a few good sites that offer TV online. The quality is amazing on some sites. The online olympic coverage on ctv.ca is better quality than my express vu @ 80 bucks a month.....
http://www.ftabins.net/  All the info you need is there.
Your ISP cannot be compelled to give your information for any civil proceedings..which is how the RIAA struck out here.
Just to remind everyone that stealing satelite signals is against the law and OFC can not support these activities by allowing discussion to continue....Sorry folks
